comments: A fantastic professor! Her Gothic fiction capstone is terrific, and her lectures are always thought-provoking and interesting. I\'ve taken two of her courses, and if I wasn\'t leaving NAU, wish I could take more!

tag_professor: Get ready to read (9)  Amazing lectures (3)  Respected (3)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (3)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Inspirational (2)  Participation matters (1)  Tough Grader (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)
comments: Dr. Reisman is absolutely wonderful and a lovely professor. I\'ve taken four of her courses, and every one of them as insightful and a fantastic learning experience. If you really want to delve into the whys of a novel, I recommend her courses! She also has a clear passion for the subject matter, and inspires a love of reading through her classes.

stu_tags: LECTURE HEAVY  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES  GET READY TO READ
comments: Dr. Reisman is awesome. She is very soft-spoken and her lectures can be very dry but she is a gem of a human and super easy grader. Read everything otherwise you won\'t be able to pass the pop reading quizzes she gives.

stu_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS  GET READY TO READ
comments: This was the first time I\'ve ever taken a class with this professor and I regret it immensely. She assigns way too many books to be read in too short of a time and the class grade is based off of one major paper and surprise assignments. I wish I had dropped this class when I had the chance. Her teaching style is boring and the class is pointless.

stu_tags: GET READY TO READ  PARTICIPATION MATTERS  INSPIRATIONAL
comments: There was definitely a lot of reading in this class, but it is all very interesting. I enjoyed this class very much, and Prof. Reisman had good insights. She helped me to read more analytically into the text, and encouraged input from the class. Do the work, and you will get a good grade.

stu_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES  GRADED BY FEW THINGS  GET READY TO READ
comments: Dr. Reisman is such a nice lady, and she really enjoys what she teaches. However, the lectures drag on forever, and she assigns too much reading. The readings she assigns are fun if you have the time to read them. There is not very much work classwork or quizzes either, so you can\'t make up work, if you fall behind.

stu_tags: RESPECTED  GET READY TO READ  AMAZING LECTURES
comments: Dr. Reisman is amazing. I loved the readings, and her commentary and lectures are thoughtful, informative, and fascinating. She\'s incredibly intelligent, and gives really insightful feedback on papers and projects, especially during office hours. Her enthusiasm for the course material is contagious. Her class was awesome. Highly recommended!

tag_professor: Get ready to read (9)  Amazing lectures (3)  Respected (3)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (3)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Inspirational (2)  Participation matters (1)  Tough Grader (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)
stu_tags: GET READY TO READ  LOTS OF HOMEWORK  AMAZING LECTURES
comments: Dr. Resiman is such a sweet lady. She is absolutely brilliant and knows so much about literature. Her class is not easy; be prepared to read 10 poems/a novel/15 pages of background notes for homework every night. She also has pop quizzes, but they are open book/open note, so take good notes! If you stay on top of your work, you will be okay!

tag_professor: Get ready to read (9)  Amazing lectures (3)  Respected (3)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (3)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Inspirational (2)  Participation matters (1)  Tough Grader (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)
stu_tags: LECTURE HEAVY  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES  GET READY TO READ
comments: The good thing is that all pop quizzes are open note, open book. Lectures are boring, and usually thats what the class is. Not many group discussions. We got to watch movies after readings, which was fun. I cannot say for sure that I\'d definitely take again, but she\'s nice. If you know what she\'s asking for, the essays and quizzes are easy.

stu_tags: TOUGH GRADER  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  GET READY TO READ
comments: I consider myself to be a pretty smart student, especially when it comes to English classes. She is a REALLY tough grader and she assigns way TOO much work. She is a very passionate teacher and is nice, but she is such a tough grader and I really wish someone would\'ve warned me not to take this class! Way too much work involved!

tag_professor: Get ready to read (9)  Amazing lectures (3)  Respected (3)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (3)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Inspirational (2)  Participation matters (1)  Tough Grader (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)
comments: While Dr. Reisman is a very nice lady, her classes could not be more boring. She doesn\'t ever change her teaching style even if it\'s clear students didn\'t read. She rarely uses visuals and prefers to lecture or read from her notes. She also rarely engages the class in discussion.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (9)  Amazing lectures (3)  Respected (3)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (3)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Inspirational (2)  Participation matters (1)  Tough Grader (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)
comments: Dr. Reisman is awesome! I was wary about taking a literature class but she does an excellent job of engaging student conversation. Very sweet, challenging but not tediously so, and overall a great professor. I go out of my way to try to take her other classes.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (9)  Amazing lectures (3)  Respected (3)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (3)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Inspirational (2)  Participation matters (1)  Tough Grader (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)
comments: Dr. Reisman is extremely patient, open-minded, and intelligent. You will learn lots from her if you discuss and participate. You will never feel ashamed for bringing up a point or expressing an opinion. She will not judge you. You will not feel scared of going to her class. You may become sleepy, though, if you do not participate in discussion.

comments: Soooo boring. Bad at encouraging class discussion. Also, clearly a feminist. Write about feminism and she\'ll give you an A!

comments: Fun class! She runs her classes like a serious book club discussion. I really did not feel stressed by her class and never received less than an A- on anything (and trust me, there were a few times it was no A work!) she provides quality concise critique on your work and is very knowledgeable.

comments: Dr. Reisman is an incredibly sweet person. Her classes can be a little slow from time to time and it\'s definitely important to have an interest in literature before taking her classes, otherwise, I\'d assume they would be a little dull.

comments: She\'s interested in the subject, but is monotone about it. Everyone is quiet in the class and seems to not feel comfortable. There\'s a lot of reading you have to keep up with, because she gives random quizzes out. She doesn\'t like whe you take bathroom breaks in the middle of class either.

comments: There was a ton of reading for the class, but most of it was interesting. You can\'t pass the class unless you do the reading. There are quizzes on most of the readings, but the essay tests after each unit are graded pretty easily.
